name: carduelis-carduelis
definition: The European goldfinch is a small passerine bird in the finch family that is native to Europe, North Africa and western Asia.
description:
European Goldfinch is one of the most colourful birds of our yards. Adult male has brown mantle and white rump.

The upperwing is black with bright yellow wing bar and white-tipped flight feathers.

Tail is black with white subterminal patches on external rectrices, and white-tipped median rectrices.

The underparts are white, with buff patches on breast sides and flanks.

On the head, face is bright red with black patches around the base of the bill. Head pattern is black and white.

Female is similar to male, but the red of the face does not extend behind the eyes. She has shorter bill too.

Fairly common in open woodland, parks, gardens, and farmland and open country with hedges and weedy patches.

In the winter goldfinches group together to form flocks of up to 40, occasionally more.

The goldfinch's preferred food is small seeds such as those from thistles and teasels, but insects are also taken when feeding young.

Goldfinch also regularly visits bird feeders, especially in the winter.

They are attracted by bird feeders containing niger seed. This seed of an annual from Africa is small, and high in oils.

Goldfinch breeds in mixed woodland, orchards, parks, commons, gardens and pine plantations where there are thistles and other plants that produce seeds.

The nest is built entirely by the female and is generally completed within a week.

The male accompanies the female, but does not contribute.

The nest is neat and compact and is generally located several meters above the ground, hidden by leaves in the twigs at the end of a swaying branch.

It is constructed of mosses and lichens and lined with plant down such as that from thistles.

It is attached to the twigs of the tree with spider silk.

A deep cup prevents the loss of eggs in windy weather.

Between four and six eggs are produced and these take up to 14 days to incubate.

Goldfinches are commonly kept and bred in captivity around the world because of their distinctive appearance and pleasant song.

If goldfinches are kept with canaries, they tend to lose their native song and call in favour of their cagemates' songs.

The song is a pleasant silvery twittering.

The call is a melodic tickeLIT, and the song is a pleasant tinkling medley of trills and twitters, but always including the tri-syllabic call phrase or a teLLIT-teLLIT-teLLIT.

European goldfinch has been introduced outside its native areas to other zones including Australia, New Zealand and Uruguay.

featured.caption: The goldfinch is a strikingly beautiful bird, with a bright red face, black and white head and a deep golden yellow bar on the otherwise jet-black wings.

related.definition: The American goldfinch is a small North American bird in the finch family.
A widespread Eurasian finch having green and yellow plumage.
The Atlantic canary , known worldwide simply as the wild canary is a small passerine bird belonging to the genus Serinus in the finch family.
